DataElement.preferredName: Person Interval Last Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has the specific time period since the last surgical procedure, a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Interval Last Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having the specific time period since the last surgical procedure, a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Interval Last Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has at least 4 weeks elapsed
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has at least 4 weeks elapsed since the patient underwent any major surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any major surgery <=28 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery within 3 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has at least 4 weeks elapsed since the patient underwent any major surgery prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a major surgery, including surgery for a new artificial implant and/or device, within 6 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has it been at least 4 weeks since the patient underwent any major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgery within 2 weeks prior to enrollment?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
